critique: The document reflects President Roosevelt's approval of an agreement within the construction industry under the National Industrial Recovery Act. This act was a key component of the New Deal, aimed at regulating industry and promoting fair competition during the Great Depression. The agreement focuses on the Painting, Paperhanging, and Decorating Division within specific Texas counties. The document indicates a strong role for the federal government in regulating the economy and industry, as well as setting standards for fair competition and labor practices.
